SUMMARY: ComR is a member of TetR family of transcriptional repressors and has been implicated in response of E. coli K-12 to copper. In in vitro experiments, ComR binds to a 60 bp promotor region upstream of comC gene [22089859] but is released in presence of copper, silver or gold. Expression of comC is dramatically increased (approx 270 fold) in a comR negative strain upon exposure to 3mM copper. comR knockout mutants have lower cytoplasmic copper levels compared to wild type when exposed to copper [22089859]. Expression of comR is not affected by copper [22089859]. Review: [22918892].
